//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this a 14-layer jack, sheets are 1x2 feet. 49 sheets total.
//1: human torso is about 7 sq. feet.  80g (canvas) x 14 (layers) x 3.5 (surface area) = 3920g
description: A thick cloth vest, intended to be worn below metal armor.  This one is made of over a dozen layers of tough canvas, and it provides fairly decent protection on its own.

//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this 10 layers, intentionally thinner than the vest, sheets are 1x2 feet. 15 sheets total
//1: human arms is about 3 sq. feet.  80g (canvas) x 10 (layers) x 1.5 (surface area) = 1200g
description: The cloth sleeves found on a typical jack.  These are thinner and meant to be worn under metal armor.  Made of many layers of tough canvas, it offers decent protection on its own.

//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making these 10 layer pants, sheets are 1x2 feet. 30 sheets total
//1: human legs is about 6 sq. feet.  80g (canvas) x 10 (layers) x 3 (surface area) = 2400g
description: Tough cloth pants worn alongside an aketon underneath metal armor.  These are made of many layers of canvas offering solid protection.

//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this 8 layers, sheets are 1x2 feet. 3 sheets total
//1: human neck is about 0.75 sq. feet.  80g (canvas) x 8 (layers) x 0.375 (surface area) = 240g
description: A cloth gorget made of many canvas layers.  A little warm but keeps your throat safe from danger, and it will fit under metal armor too.

//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this 8 layers, sheets are 1x2 feet. 10 sheets total
//1: human head total is about 2.5 sq. feet.  80g (canvas) x 8 (layers) x 1.25 (surface area) = 800g
description: A cloth coif with neck protection.  Resting on your shoulders, it serves as padding for a helmet.  Though it's pretty warm, it is constructed of tough canvas and provides substantial protection even on its own.

//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this a 30-layer jack, sheets are 1x2 feet. 105 sheets total.  10-layer thick skirt for roughly 40 more sheets (145)
//1: human torso is about 7 sq. feet.  80g (canvas) x 30 (layers) x 3.5 (surface area) = 8400g + 40x80 = 11600g total
description: A thick cloth tunic intended to be worn as standalone armor, as it's a little too thick to add chainmail or a cuirass on top.  Made of thirty layers of tough canvas, this will protect you from almost everything, but it's very heavy and warm.

//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making this 20 layers, intentionally thinner than the vest, sheets are 1x2 feet. 30 sheets total
//1: human arms is about 3 sq. feet.  80g (canvas) x 20 (layers) x 1.5 (surface area) = 2400g
description: The cloth sleeves found on a typical jack.  These are very thick, meant as standalone armor, and won't fit under metal armor comfortably.  Made of a huge number of canvas layers, they offer superb protection, but they're very heavy and warm.

//: roughly 0.25mm per sheet of canvas making these 20 layer pants, sheets are 1x2 feet. 40 sheets total
//1: human legs is about 6 sq. feet.  80g (canvas) x 20 (layers) x 3 (surface area) = 4800g

name.str_pl: pairs of canvas heavy arming pants

description: Tough, thick cloth pants worn on their own alongside a gambeson.  These are made of a huge number of canvas layers offering very solid protection, though they're too thick to easily add metal armor on top and are both stuffy and restrictive.
